byline.contributor: Paula Moura contributed reporting from Brasília, and Vinod Sreeharsha from Rio de Janeiro.

abstract: Brazil's lower house of Congress votes in favor of impeaching embattled second-term Pres Dilma Rousseff; if country's Senate follows with majority in favor of impeachment, Rousseff will face Senate trial and step down from presidency during process; Vice Pres Michel Temer would take over post.
lead_paragraph: The vote sends the case to the Senate, which will decide whether to hold a trial on charges that the president illegally used money from state-owned banks.

headline.main: Brazil’s Lower House of Congress Votes for Impeachment of Dilma Rousseff
headline.print_headline: Vote to Impeach Brazil’s Leader Passes Strongly

snippet: The vote sends the case to the Senate, which will decide whether to hold a trial on charges that the president illegally used money from state-owned banks.
